Object Flight Path: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
divs: sighting detailsi'll just get to it.. i have 20\20 vision.. no drinking tonight. it was early morning, and i couldn't sleep.. went outside to have a smoke.. just sitting there staring up at the sky, not totally paying attention and then a very dim twinkling star caught my attention, and it was wavey-looking as if i was witnessing it through a hot-air distortion, but then i discovered it was moving (or began to move), and then it got crisp and clear.. i thought at that point, ok, it's must be a satellite.. but it had another light following along very closely, and i thought i saw a shadow of under belly of a craft or something geometrical (if i had to pick i'd say triangular-ish looking shape).. and the second diagonally trailing light was dimmer slightly.. and more orange-ish in color.. i would have guessed this was very high up.. it was tiny looking.. i would never had seen it if i had not been gazing out at that exact spot where i first found it. the first light didn't have much color, but it wasn't stark white either.. just very dim.. and then i thought, ok, that's a big satellite probably. and in the process of watching it, it did a graceful but nice 25 degree arc to the west. then i sat straight up, practically fell out of my chair.. got up.. and lost sight of it. it was so dim folks.. it was originally cruising south-south west.. now it would be south-west and westerly in direction.. hope that helps anyone who might have seen something like this around these parts lately.. it was exciting to see that, and i have been watching the skies around here for a quite a while and haven't seen anything remotely like that.. it was the turn it made.. completely unpredictable.. birds don't catch reflections like that at night.. we do have fruit bats, but i know what those look like.. this was slow, not quick, and there was no noise. i would say it was half the speed (or less) of anything else i have seen cruise around in the sky day or night.. almost a nice fluid like motion to it. i haven't seen anything like it before, that's for sure. looked controlled, and no winds tonight.. great viability.. lots of stars.. had a nice meteor sighting last night as well, was going to report it, but someone else did.. the meteor last night was located in this south.. it moved from the sse to ssw very quickly.. it must have been big and re-entered quickly.. brightest meteor i have seen in a long while too. however like the other guy that reported it in gilbert, i didn't actually see the streak, i saw the shadows that it made across the yard.. it lit everything up like a magnesium flare.. anyways.. hope this helps..
trends: There have been 4 other sightings in Paradise Valley
There were no other sightings in Paradise Valley on or around May 26th 2009
Summary: Thought it was a satellite but it changed directions and faded out.
